text: Mohammad Abshak () (born 27 January 1987 in Rasht, Iran) is an Iranian footballer. ==Club career== Abshak starts his career with Sepidrood youth team. In 2007, after playing 3 seasons for Sepidrood, he joined Pegah that just got promoted to Iran Pro League, but could not play a single game for them because of army services, so he joined Fajr Gilan instead. In 2008—after fishing his army services—he returned to Pegah in Iran Pro League but could not play a single game again due injury. In October 2008, Pegah was sold and renamed to Damash Gilan. In the next season, Damash was relegated to Azadegan League and Firouz Karimi was appointed as a Head Coach. Abashk could prove himself to Karimi and was the starter in most of games. Since then, he has been a member of the team and one of its key players ==Club statistics== Last Update 9 April 2016 Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Iran Iran Iran League League Hazfi Cup Hazfi Cup Total Total 2008–09 Damash Pro League 0 0 0 0 0 0 2009–10 Azadegan League 21 1 3 0 24 1 2010–11 Azadegan League 23 0 3 0 26 0 2011–12 Pro League 17 1 1 0 18 1 2012–13 Pro League 16 1 4 0 20 0 2013–14 Pro League 8 0 0 0 8 0 2013–14 Mes Pro League 10 0 2014–15 Rah Ahan Pro League 8 0 1 0 9 0 2014–15 Malavan Pro League 12 0 0 0 12 0 2015–16 Pro League 16 0 0 0 16 0 Total Total Total 131 3 ==Honours== *Hazfi Cup **Runner-up: 1 ***2013–14 with Mes Kerman ==References== ==Other websites== *Iran Pro League Stats *persianleague.com Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Iranian footballers Category:Association football midfielders
